org.pikater.web.vaadin.gui.client.kineticengine.modules

Class SelectionModule

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.pikater.web.vaadin.gui.client.kineticengine.modules.SelectionModule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IEngineModule

    public class SelectionModule
extends java.lang.Object
implements IEngineModule
    Module managing all selection-related code. Boxes may be directly selected with the left mouse button and edges are selected automatically if both their endpoint boxes are selected.
    Author:
    SkyCrawl

        public void createModuleCrossReferences()

      • getGraphItemTypesToAttachHandlersTo

        public java.lang.String[] getGraphItemTypesToAttachHandlersTo()
        Description copied from interface: IEngineModule

        Return an array of class names of graph items that this module uses for its operation (attaches event handlers to).

        Example: 

        return new String[] { GWTMisc.getSimpleName(BoxGraphItemClient.class) };
        Specified by:
        getGraphItemTypesToAttachHandlersTo in interface IEngineModule

      • attachHandlers

        public void attachHandlers(AbstractGraphItemClient<?> graphItem)
        Description copied from interface: IEngineModule
        Attach your required event handlers to the given graph item, if needed. Consult IEngineModule.getGraphItemTypesToAttachHandlersTo().
        Specified by:
        attachHandlers in interface IEngineModule

      • doSelectionRelatedOperation

        public void doSelectionRelatedOperation(SelectionModule.SelectionOperation opKind,
                               boolean drawOnFinish,
                               boolean notifyServer,
                               BoxGraphItemClient... boxes)
        A single method for all selection related operations, acts as a guidepost. Only boxes can be selected/deselected with this method as it internally selects/deselects the appropriate edges too.
        As huge as this method aims to be, it concentrates heavy logic into this class while offering a simple declarative interface to the calling code.

      • onEdgeDragFinish

        public void onEdgeDragFinish(EdgeGraphItemClient edge,
                    BoxGraphItemClient originalEndPoint,
                    BoxGraphItemClient newEndPoint,
                    BoxGraphItemClient staticEndPoint)
        Parameters:
        originalEndPoint - the original endpoint of the edge
        newEndPoint - the new endpoint of the edge
        staticEndPoint - the other endpoint of the edge that is unaffected by the drag operation
